hint.text: Use elimination method to solve the pair of equations.

solution.text:
Let the 1st number be x
And, other number be y
now, according to the question:
x = _{j}_y
i.e., x - _{j}_y = 0 -------(1)
And, x - y = _{i}_ -------(2)
Multiply equation (2) by _{j}_ to make coefficient of y equal.
Then we get the equations:
x - _{j}_y = 0 -------(3)
_{j}_x - _{j}_y = _{{i*j}}_ -------(4)
Subtract equations.(1) from equation (2).
So, we get
_{{j-1}}_x + (_{j}_-_{j}_)y = _{{i*j}}_
i.e.,_{{j-1}}_x = _{{j*i}}_
i.e.,x = \(_{{i*j}}_\over _{{j-1}}_\)
i.e.,x = \(_{{trunc((Decimal(i)*j)/(j-1),2)}}_\)
Now, Substitute the value of x in equation 1.
We get
\(_{{i*j}}_\over _{{j-1}}_\) - _{j}_y = 0
_{j}_y = \(_{{i*j}}_\over _{{j-1}}_\)
y = \(_{{i*j}}_\over _{{(j-1)*j}}_\)
y = \(_{{trunc(Decimal(i)/(j-1),2)}}_\)
So, the solution required is:
x = \(_{{trunc((Decimal(i)*j)/(j-1),2)}}_\) and y = \(_{{trunc(Decimal(i)/(j-1),2)}}_\)

content.text: The difference between two numbers is _{i}_ and one number is _{j}_ times of other.Find the numbers.
